Blog.post: i started typing this blog to get some things off my chest! it is unusually tough moving from one place to another and trying to do all these things at once. i have been just shuting down most of the time;taking the easy way out. i was expecting to have some comments! but how? the thousands of blogs are bombarding with people from around the world! that's not a bad thing, but there needs to be an easier way to read what you want to read and comment on them! can't we get a voting system of what is being read or what is of interest? i doubt any one will read this so i guess this is just going to have to be a therapeutic forum!
urlLink Marianne Williamson - Author / Lecturer Marianne Williamson is right! I sabotage a lot of me! I just want to rise up and turn my dreams into goals!
Can I break the patterns of life and choose another?
I really don't know what I am doing, with anything! God help me!

Every time I drive somewhere, I am confronted with slow, bad drivers; so I speed to my destination! I gun it to the next red light and floor it well above the speed limit! Speed does not kill people, carelessness does! I am extremely safe! And forget turning signals, I am going faster! Even though I am in Colorado, California stops are preferred. My Yields are safe! I have to make evasive maneuvers in an out of lanes to avoid the slow ones! I am very safe when doing this! Regardless of how many times I have been down the same roads and exits, I will always wait to the last minute and jump in the lane! Again, I am going faster! I am cautious! It is a must to honk my horn, flash my highs, raise my fist and finger when someone cuts me off. I do not care if s/he had their blinker on and waved in the mirror. I am going faster, and one car in my lane is slowing me down. I never make mistakes when I drive, so if I abruptly end up in your lane, and you honk, of course I am going to honk back and cuss at you! Finally, I would not hesitate to stop traffic if the road suddenly changes on me. You should be paying attention to me in front of you anyway!
